subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: SchemaCrawler allows scripting with database metadata, using Groovy. This example shows how to script with Groovy.

ol.li: Install ant, and make sure that ant is on your path
Make sure that java is on your PATH
Start the database server by running the StartDatabaseServer script from the distribution directory
Start a command shell in the groovy example directory
Run groovy.cmd (or groovy.sh on Unix) to use Groovy integration
Try modifying the Groovy in the *.groovy files to do different things. You also have access to a live database connection.
